metadata.name: BMAD Ralph Plugin
metadata.description: Autonomous AI agent loop for Claude Code that automates story execution following the BMAD methodology. Ralph executes user stories from sprint backlogs with quality gates, progress tracking, and intelligent stuck detection.
metadata.tagline: Automate your BMAD sprint stories with autonomous AI execution

required.name: jq
required.description: JSON processor for parsing configuration files

required.name: yq
required.description: YAML processor for parsing sprint files

required.name: git
required.description: Version control system for branch management

optional.name: perplexity-mcp-server
optional.description: Perplexity AI integration for research capabilities

quick_start.description: Install the BMAD Ralph plugin directly from the Claude Code marketplace

manual_installation.description: Install the plugin manually from the GitHub repository
steps: Navigate to your Claude Code plugins directory
Copy the `.claude-plugin` directory to your plugins folder
Restart Claude Code to load the plugin

linux.ubuntu: sudo apt-get install jq git && sudo snap install yq
linux.fedora: sudo dnf install jq yq git

windows.description: Install dependencies using Chocolatey or WSL2
windows.wsl2: Follow Linux installation instructions in WSL2

steps: Verify dependencies: `/bmad-ralph:init --help` will check for dependencies
Optional: Set up Perplexity MCP for research capabilities
Create your first loop: `/bmad-ralph:init` in a BMAD project

upgrade_instructions.description: How to upgrade from a previous version
steps: Back up existing loops: `cp -r ralph/ ralph-backup/`
Verify upgrade: Check plugin loads without errors
